text: James Earl Jones (January 17, 1931 - September 9, 2024) was an American actor. He was famous for doing the voice of Darth Vader in the Star Wars movies, for doing the voice of Mufasa in The Lion King and in the 2019 remake, and for the CNN tagline ("This...is CNN"). He starred in Lincoln Portrait which has music by Aaron Copland. Jones won two Tony Awards for his live theatre work on Broadway. He won an Emmy Award for his role on the television series Gabriel's Fire. In 1991, he became the first actor to win two Emmys in the same year. He was a son of actor Robert Earl Jones. == Death == Jones died at his home in Pawling, New York on September 9, 2024. He was 93 years old. He had diabetes at the time of his death. ==Film== Year Title Role Notes 1964 Dr. Strangelove 1967 Krafsur 1997, pg. 193 1967 Himself Short film 1970 Doctor D Krafsur 1997, pg. 303 1970 Krafsur 1997, pg. 429 1970 King: A Filmed Record...
